FIERY.Definition: full of strong feelings or energy

MERCENARY.Definition: a soldier who fought for money, not for his country

COUP.Definition: a sudden try to take control of the country by force

INFRASTRUCTURE.Definition: roads, buildings, and other basic things a country needs

IN DISGUISE.Definition: appearing to be something that it is not

PROXY WAR.Definition: a war where big countries fought through smaller ones

DRAGGED ON.Definition: kept going for a long time

TIDE.Definition: the course or direction of the events

BARRELS.Definition: large round containers for holding liquids, like oil

MUTUALLY.Definition: shared by two or more groups

NEPOTISM.Definition: giving jobs to family or friends instead of the best people

BARREL.Definition: a round container used for storing things like oil

DIVERSIFY.Definition: add different things, not just one kind

IN THE GRAND SCHEME OF THINGS.Definition: looking at the big picture or overall view

RELIABLE.Definition: able to be trusted or counted on

MOMENTUM.Definition: the speed or force that kept things going

INSTITUTIONS.Definition: important organisations, like schools or banks

TRICKLE-DOWN.Definition: money or help slowly reaching poorer people

CRONIES.Definition: close friends (used for bad or selfish reasons)

TURNING A BLIND EYE.Definition: pretending not to see something wrong

CORRUPT.Definition: using power in a dishonest way

IRRESPONSIBLE.Definition: not careful, not thinking about the results

TERMS.Definition: the rules or parts of the agreement

ASHES.Definition: what was left after destruction and ruin

PROSPERITY.Definition: the state of being successful and rich

A RAINY DAY.Definition: a time when things go wrong or money is needed

PREACHES.Definition: tells people strongly what to think or do

CAUTIONARY TALE.Definition: a story that warns about danger or mistakes
